WRITING.TEXT:
Mine are pretty normal ones that I think most people have.
- lose weight (around 15kg to start with) - eat better - read at least 12 books - ask my girlfriend to marry me - save 15% of my income for the year - plan and book an overseas trip
DDR... sooo good!

WRITING.TITLE: After my miserable Christmas being sick, I finally got better so my girlfriend and I dressed up and went out to celebrate!

WRITING.TEXT: Birdcage is on tonight. It's at the slyfox, from 9pm onwards. I haven't been in a while (it use to be at Zanzibar) so I'm going to check it out.

WRITING.TITLE: What tastes good when eaten with something else, but disgusting when eaten on its own?

WRITING.TEXT: Because Christmas is already over. Love, Australia.

WRITING.TITLE: What's been your biggest "I told you so!" moment?

WRITING.TEXT: Would the doctor put me on antibiotics for that? And how can I ensure it doesn't get passed to my partner or anyone else? house is now full of people for Christmas. I don't want anyone else to get it.

Cheers. I had some of the anti diarrheal stuff. I wish I could stop the bloating and the burping. I haven't come into contact with any unclean water that I know of. I only guessed it was giardiasis from googling about the sulfur burps. My sister was sick last week with vomiting when she stayed at my house , then her baby was sick too and vomited a lot. I changed her babies diaper while she was over. Her husband got incredibly sick a few days ago and vomited a lot. Could it be food poisoning?

WRITING.TITLE: Do I have giardiasis?
WRITING.TEXT:
It's Christmas Eve here and so I don't think I'll be able to see a doctor for about 2 days. I haven't been feeling well all week. I had a cold and that started to get better after 2 days. Then on day 3 my cold was gone but I had nausea. Now I've got stomach cramps (thought it was my period) but I completely lost my appetite too, and I get these burps that smell like rotten egg. From what I googled, they're "sulfur burps". I also have diarrhea, but it's more watery than anything else.
Is there anything I can do to stop the burping and the diarrhea over Christmas til I can see a doctor?

If anyone wants to get some cool Aussie coins, I got this set for OP from downies. It was close to my work, but this place ships overseas too. They'll have a Boxing Day sale on too. http://www.downies.com
This is what Logan from Gilmore girls did. I thought it was made up!

WRITING.TITLE: My adventure cat, Pigsly, in the backyard.

WRITING.TEXT: Glad you like it :)
Not on Australian Netflix anyway. Oh well, I'll see what I can find online.
I just checked, it's not on Netflix :(
I don't know what this show is, but how do I watch all of it. Now.

I once got on a train at Redfern during peak hour and spotted a free two seater, so I grabbed it before anyone else. I sat down on the outside seat (luckily) and only after I had sat down did I notice the huge pile of spew next to me. I should have known there was a reason why a two seater was free on a crowded train.
Did you see a therapist or seek out help groups or anything like that?

WRITING.TITLE: PTSD sufferers of reddit, how do you cope with it on a day to day basis?

WRITING.TEXT: My uncle died two days ago. I was at a loss at how to comfort my cousin. My partner (who has lost her late partner, then 6 months later, her dad) gave me the exact same advice. She said it also didn't help that people would comfort her and say "oh you're still young, you'll find someone else". The other things that helped were when people brought over groceries instead of flowers, because she couldn't really muster up energy to go to the shops for anything. She said she was also grateful when people bought over boxes of tissues because she was always running out.
What made you want to have a kid?

WRITING.TITLE: Couples of reddit, what changes, good and bad, came about when your other couple friends started having kids?

WRITING.TEXT: That particular manager was just a douche really. I've had another managers who don't put up with shit from customers, and i was always grateful for them. They made working in retail just that little bit better.

True. I worked in a store and I had a man go on a racist rant towards me and I was just shocked. My coworkers were shocked too, no one said anything. He left and we spoke to our manager about it, and he brushed it off with "just ignore it, the customer is always right".
It's one thing to say racist horrible things online, but when someone is saying it to your face, it does leave you a bit flabbergasted and speechless.

WRITING.TITLE: My Secret Santa is a legend!

WRITING.TEXT: holy crap, I can't believe how cheap it is! I was thinking that the monitors alone would set me back $300 each.
